heroSubheading: ओंकारेश्वर की शांति का अनुभव करें
heroText: One of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva, on an island shaped like 'Om'.

sections.royalTownDesc: Associated with Adi Shankaracharya and ancient Hindu scriptures.
sections.aboutDesc: One of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva, on an island shaped like 'Om'.
sections.practicalTipsDesc: Planning your visit for a smooth experience.

overview: Omkareshwar is a sacred island town in the Khandwa district of Madhya Pradesh, India.
It is one of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva.
The town is situated on Mandhata Island in the Narmada River, naturally shaped like 'Om'.

city.name: Omkareshwar
city.significance: One of the twelve Jyotirlinga shrines of Lord Shiva, on an island shaped like 'Om'.
city.historicalImportance: Associated with Adi Shankaracharya and ancient Hindu scriptures.

temples.name: Omkareshwar Jyotirlinga Temple
temples.description: One of the 12 Jyotirlingas, dedicated to Lord Shiva.

rituals.name: Abhishek Pooja
rituals.description: Sacred ritual involving the bathing of the Shiva Lingam.
